contents.markdown: We had previous lessons on how to like/dislike nouns. In this lesson we learn how to like/dislike verbs, plus a lot more. _Gusto_ and _ayaw_ are called “pseudo-verbs”, which are special adjectives that resemble verbs in a “verb followed by infinitive” structure. There are a few “real” verbs that serve a similar purpose, and we will cover one in a future lesson, but they are less common. There are two groups of pseudo-verbs. This lesson covers _ng_ pseudo verbs, and the next lesson covers plain pseudo-verbs.

About _ng_ pseudo-verbs: although I listed six above, we are not going to use _ibig_ or _nais_ because they are not as common as _gusto_. And we are not going to use _kaya_ because it has overlapping meanings with the plain pseudo-verb _puwede_. Formally, _kaya_ is more about ability and _puwede_ is more about permission, but colloquially this distinction is often lost. Also, it is easy for a beginner to confuse _kaya_ for a conjunction that you will learn in a future lesson. That leaves us with _gusto, ayaw_ and _kailangan_.
Non-AF Ng Pseudo verb Sentence = **Ng pseudo-verb** (+ linker) + Non-AF SS.
**Notes: The verb takes infinitive. The linker goes before the verb. Use the linker if it is -_ng_ type, but omit it if it is _na_.**

Similar to what you saw with the adj + infinitive structure, although the linker is optional here, native speakers will normally use it if can be a -_ng_ type modification, but omit it where it would be na, so that is what we do in this book.
To form these, take all the enclitics out of the non-AF standard sentence and put them after the pseudo-verb, then change the verb to infinitive.

item.tagalog: Kailangan lang niyang lutuin ang adobo.
item.english: She only needs to cook the adobo.

item.tagalog: Gusto pong makita ni Maria ang bisikleta ninyo.
item.english: Maria wants to see your bicycle. (resp.)
I do not like to give you money.

contents.markdown: AF Ng Pseudo-verb Sentence = **Ng pseudo-verb** + actor (+ linker) + AF SS without actor.
**Notes: Actor takes _ng_ form, verb takes infinitive. The linker goes before the verb. Use the linker if it is -_ng_ type, but omit it if it is _na_.**

Form these the same way as non-AF, except put the actor just before the linker, and change it to _ng_ form. That is why these are called _ng_ form pseudo-verbs; even AF actors need to be changed to _ng_ form. Notice that, unlike non-AF, actors that are not pps are still moved in before the verb:

item.tagalog: Gusto rin ni Mariang matulog sa kuwarto niya.
item.english: Maria also wants to sleep in her room.

item.tagalog: Ayaw ni Joshuang magbigay ng piso.
item.english: Joshua does not want to give a peso.

contents.markdown: Optionally, you can leave the actor in the standard sentence, but it must still take _ng_ form:

item.tagalog: Gusto ring matulog ni Maria sa kuwarto niya.
item.english: Maria also wants to sleep in her room.

contents.markdown: This is less common, so we will not do it anymore in this book.
_Ayaw_ is used to negate _gusto_. Negate all other pseudo-verb sentences with _hindi_, and do not forget to put the enclitics after _hindi_. Remember that the linker always goes before the verb.

item.tagalog: Hindi lang niya kailangang lutuin ang adobo.
item.english: She does not only need to cook the adobo.

item.tagalog: Ayaw pong makita ni Maria ang bisikleta ninyo.
item.english: Maria does not want to see your bicycle. (resp.)

item.tagalog: Hindi ko kailangang gumawa ng halo-halo.
item.english: I do not need to make halo-halo.

contents.markdown: Remember that for AF _ng_ pseudo verb sentences, non-pp actors stay before the verb; they do not go right after _hindi_ like the enclitics.

item.english: She does not need to cook. (resp.) But:

item.tagalog: Hindi po kailangan ni nanay na magluto.
item.english: Mother does not need to cook. (resp.)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Gusto pa naman niyang lumaki sa Cebu.
exampleSentences.english: In contrast, she would still like to grow up in Cebu.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ayaw kainan ni Jessica ng halo-halo ang baso.
exampleSentences.english: Jessica does not like to eat halo-halo out of the glass.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kailangan ni David pumunta sa ilalim ng gusali.
exampleSentences.english: David needs to go underneath the building.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Gusto silang sabihan ng petsa ng mahirap na lalaki kapag nandun siya.
exampleSentences.english: The poor man wants to tell them a date while he is there.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ayaw din nilang sumakay ng bus papunta sa eskwelahan.
exampleSentences.english: They do not want to ride a bus to school either (also).

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi ninyo kailangang taniman ng mga ito ang CR.
exampleSentences.english: You (pl.) do not need to plant these in the restroom.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Gusto ba ni Analyng mamatay sa tabi ng pinto mo?
exampleSentences.english: Does Analyn want to die beside your door?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ayaw kong hanapin ang aso ni Jasmine sa labas.
exampleSentences.english: I do not want to look for Jasmine’s dog outside.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi natin kailangang manalo ng pera sa loob ng kuwarto.
exampleSentences.english: We (incl.) do not need to win money inside the room.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Gustong inumin ng estudyante ito dito, sa ibabaw ng bahay.
exampleSentences.english: The student wants to drink this here, above the house.
